snippet: Researchers have found sensory neurons in mice that are dedicated to relaying itchy sensations, and such cells are almost certainly in people too. Why we itch, however, remains a mystery.
abstract: Xinzhong Dong study in journal Nature Neuroscience reports discovery of sensory neurons in mice that are dedicated to relaying itchy sensations; broader understanding of itching remains elusive to science.
lead_paragraph: Researchers have found sensory neurons in mice that are dedicated to relaying itchy sensations, and such cells are almost certainly in people too. Why we itch, however, remains a mystery.
